## Bananas

## Introduction

Oklahoma’s HB 1795 went into effect November 1, 2021 (Q2 FY 2022), reducing the number of offenses for which a license must be revoked (specific circumstances may still result in a revocation) while increasing the accessibility and affordability of provisional licenses. Additionally, the bill lowers the minimum payment plan for outstanding fines and fees (including but not limited to, provisional license fees, warrant fees, court costs or fees, and driver license reinstatements fees) from $25 per month to $5 per month the bill imposes limitations on “failure to pay” license suspension.
